Ask HN: How to easily know a CPU code name on Linux
text:
How can we conveniently and easily know a Cpu code name by a Linux' tool or CLI,

ie. not only its feature specification but also for Intel brand

e.g Skylake for Intel Xeon, Intel Celeron, Cherry Trail for Intel Atom Kaby Lake Intel Core, Intel Celeron Apollo Lake ?

title: Sequoia ARC was a joke and shame on Jess Lee
text:
Fraud and deception

I only applied to the ARC program after seeing an interview from Jess Lee and Emily Chang, Jess described ARC as the program for outlier founders who often GET OVER LOOKED FOR FUNDING. however when you look at who was chosen for this batch, how on earth are 90% of these selected founders f-ing outliers, 1 founder is literally a head at instagram, another founder literally was literally the youngest engineer at amazon and work at a start that sold to twitch, and literally the cherry on top, another founder literally works at sequoia and had already raised 7M in funding. F sequoia and I’ll never let these scumbags invest in my company or future companies. Im not mad I wasn’t selected, I’m mad because they used the hardship of minorities and exploited that for marketing, only to go around a fund mfs who could easily get funding.

Disclaimer I apply this last batch and didnt get accepted or even interview but seeing the companies that were picked this batch has me sick to my stomach.

Ask HN: How do you do a Continuous Delivery?
text: What software do you use? How much time did it take your team to set up a CD? How much time do you spend on maintenance? How big was your team when you set up a proper CD?

title: Show HN: Figr.app – a multi-user, notepad style calculator (desktop app)
text:
Hi all, just posting an update to my previous Show HN, where I announced a side-project I worked on which was a (web version) of a multi-user, notepad style calculator:

https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=31817997

After a couple of user requests (and having a good think about it) I decided to migrate the web UI to create a Mac and Windows desktop app. After using it a little bit, I feel this is a much better experience than the webapp, and reduces a lot of the friction if I wanted to run a few small calculations.

You can find the download links below:

https://www.figr.app/download

For context, Figr was a side project I worked on to get back into coding after being in management for the last few years. It's kind of a cross between popular notepad style calculators (like Soulver, Numi, etc), but also has multi-user editing (like Google Docs). I've got some example templates below which hopefully show what it can do, and hopefully is relevant to the community:

- https://www.figr.app/s/RUNWAY - An example to work out your burn rate / runway

- https://www.figr.app/s/LTVCAC - An LTV/CAC calculator

- https://www.figr.app/s/CONTRACTOR - Hourly rate calculator for contractors

Opened to feedback, or technical questions if others are in the process of moving, or thinking about moving their webapps to desktop apps, as it's been quite a journey!

Thanks!

title: Pouty: A silly library meant to add C++ I/O APIs (iostream) to Python
Tell HN: Be aware of the Cloudflare vanity name servers
text: Cloudflare has been suggesting vanity name servers, which is an automated process to get that and generate the name server records. This, of course, is not enough - you also need to manually submit a ticket to them if they are your registrar, and so far, after more than 3 calendar days, they have not updated our domain putting our email delivery at risk. If you're using decent domain registrars (they don't seem to be one!), this feature is built right into the interface, and you can do this yourself. Not with Cloudflare! After submitting an urgent-level request, 2-3 hours later, there was no response. Then I reached a general support team member on chat and they promised that this will be escalated (although priority was already "urgent"). It didn't get escalated - it got de-escalated to "high". And more than 72 hours later, the issue still exist and MxToolbox gives us a bunch of warnings and our email ends up in spam! So, the moral of the story is that you shouldn't use Cloudflare for domain registrations! if it takes them days to attend urgent issues, and you cannot chat or speak to their registrar department!
